p: Isolation yielded 959 isolates, with Gammaproteobacteria being the most represented class, followed by the class Alphaproteobacteria and the phyla Actinobacteria, Bacteroidetes, Acidobacteria, and Firmicutes ( Supplementary Figure 1A). The largest share of isolates was represented by the Burkholderia-Caballeronia-Paraburkholderia complex (17%), followed by the genera Mucilaginibacter (7%) and Pseudomonas (7%, Supplementary Figure 1B). Isolates clustered into 467 OTUs (>99% similarity) and were binned to 4.5% of OTUs from the 16S rRNA amplicon study from the same CWD samples published previously (Tláskal et al., 2017). The isolates represented on average 33.5 ± 1.3% of bacteria in a CWD sample. The youngest age class of deadwood, comprising CWD samples with a decay length <5 years, was most represented by the isolates (38.8 ± 2.6%).
